p: The use of serum in culture media presents a safety hazard and source of unwanted contamination for the production of biopharmaceuticals. As a number of cell lines can be grown in serum-free media supplemented with certain components of bovine fetal serum, the development of this type of medium with a defined composition has intensified in the last few decades. Eagle (1959) developed a “minimal essential medium” composed of balanced salts, glucose, amino acids, and vitamins. In the last 50 years, considerable work has been carried out to develop more efficient culture media to meet the specific requirements of specific cell lines.
